intro: Cyphostemma leucorufescens, commonly known as the white-barked tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white or pale bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-red fruits. It is typically found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native environment.
